Eric Karschner

(570) 494-6150 Â· erickarschner@gmail.com

I am an Android developer and data scientist, currently studying Computational Mathematics at Rochester Institute of Technology. I am the director of Research and Development for Computer Science House, a student-run organization at RIT dedicated to providing an educational environment for individuals interested in computer science.

Projects

Jeopardy!

A replication of the classic game show Jeopardy!, with a React frontend, Android application, and Python backend. Contestants can join on the native Android app, or the React mobile-friendly website. One user is designated the host and guides the players through the game, showing clues and correct responses on the board. Points and buzzers are managed on a central server, which communicates with the various clients using WebSockets.

Technologies used:

  • React.js
  • Kotlin
  • Python
  • Django (channels)
  • WebSockets
January 2021 - May 2021

CSH AnDrink

Computer Science House has an on-floor system of networked vending machines, which members can access via a RESTful API to drop drinks and snacks. The AnDrink app provides a way for members to authenticate requests using their Single Sign On credentials, view their "drink credits", and drop items from the vending machines. Authentication is performed using the official OAuth v2 library for Android.

Technologies used:

  • Kotlin
  • Android Room
  • Fuel
  • MVVM
January 2021 - May 2021
